dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan's foreign ministry is really pushing this issue of their citizens being denied entry into Georgia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan's foreign ministry is really pushing this issue of their citizens being denied entry into Georgia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the Kazakh side expressed concern over the increasing number of entry refusals and subsequent deportations of Kazakh citizens arriving in Georgia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but, um, the Georgian side did respond, right? They mentioned that refusals have actually decreased since May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but, um, the Georgian side did respond, right? They mentioned that refusals have actually decreased since May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In response, the Georgian side reported that the number of refusals has significantly decreased since the beginning of May, and this positive trend is expected to continue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I don't know, it still seems like a pretty serious diplomatic concern. They're talking about extradition and criminal law cooperation too—it's not just tourism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I don't know, it still seems like a pretty serious diplomatic concern. They're talking about extradition and criminal law cooperation too-it's not just tourism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The parties discussed a wide range of consular issues, including criminal law cooperation, extradition, protection of citizens' rights, and compliance with international treaties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but like, the Georgians are saying they want to create favorable conditions. That's like a step in the right direction, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but like, the Georgians are saying they want to create favorable conditions. That's like a step in the right direction, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Georgian side expressed its readiness to create the most favorable conditions for the entry and stay of Kazakh citizens in Georgia, the ministry added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe, but why were there so many deportations in the first place? The Kazakh side emphasized most travelers are just tourists following the rules.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe, but why were there so many deportations in the first place? The Kazakh side emphasized most travelers are just tourists following the rules.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was emphasized that the vast majority of Kazakh citizens travel to Georgia for tourism purposes and conscientiously follow the laws of the host country, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Kazakhstan stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and uh, consular consultations in Tbilisi did happen—both sides had representatives there discussing this stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and uh, consular consultations in Tbilisi did happen-both sides had representatives there discussing this stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Consular consultations were held in Tbilisi between the foreign ministries of Kazakhstan and Georgia, with representatives of relevant government bodies from both countries also in attendance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, it feels like there's more to this. You don't hold high-level talks just over a few tourist visas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, it feels like there's more to this. You don't hold high-level talks just over a few tourist visas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're also covering protection of citizens' rights and international treaties, so it's broader, but the immediate issue seems to be improving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're also covering protection of citizens' rights and international treaties, so it's broader, but the immediate issue seems to be improving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The parties discussed a wide range of consular issues, including criminal law cooperation, extradition, protection of citizens' rights, and compliance with international treaties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I guess we'll see if that positive trend they mentioned actually continues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess we'll see if that positive trend they mentioned actually continues.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And with both foreign ministries involved, there's at least a channel for dialogue now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And with both foreign ministries involved, there's at least a channel for dialogue now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Consular consultations were held in Tbilisi between the foreign ministries of Kazakhstan and Georgia, with representatives of relevant government bodies from both countries also in attendance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hopefully it doesn't escalate further. Deportations can really strain relations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hopefully it doesn't escalate further. Deportations can really strain relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But the fact that they're talking—and in person—is a good sign, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But the fact that they're talking-and in person-is a good sign, you know?
